channel.title: CVE Feed for GraniteDS -- Framework
channel.description: The latest CVEs for GraniteDS -- Framework

item.title: CVE-2017-3199|2024-08-05T14:16:28.247Z -- graniteds -- framework
item.description: The Java implementation of GraniteDS, version 3.1.1.GA, AMF3 deserializers derives class instances from java.io.Externalizable rather than the AMF3 specification's recommendation of flash.utils.IExternalizable. A remote attacker with the ability to spoof or control an RMI server connection may be able to send serialized Java objects that execute arbitrary code when deserialized.

item.title: CVE-2017-3200|2024-08-05T14:16:28.479Z -- graniteds -- framework
item.description: The Java implementation of AMF3 deserializers used in GraniteDS, version 3.1.1.G, may allow instantiation of arbitrary classes via their public parameter-less constructor and subsequently call arbitrary Java Beans setter methods. The ability to exploit this vulnerability depends on the availability of classes in the class path that make use of deserialization. A remote attacker with the ability to spoof or control information may be able to send serialized Java objects with pre-set properties that result in arbitrary code execution when deserialized.
